} if (cv_mo26102GLKAR8O6currentClick) { return cv_mo26102GLKAR8O6currentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:10 MinsI'm giving this four starts because the one I received from Amazon.com fulfillment arrived in a box full of small paper flakes. They were all over the device, sticking to the protective screen sticker provided by the manufacturer for transport. Not only were they all over the device and sticking to the side stickers, but I found them under the screen's protective sticker as if no one cared there was dust/paper flakes all over it. Part of the Samsung label on the back of the device appears faded due to sliding around in the box during shipping.I chose a white 32 GB Note because I prefer it over black. Right away I noticed the top of my device by the camera has this red blemish. Upon closer inspection I noticed that whomever attached the front bezel of the Note didn't align the stuff under it correctly, so what I'm seeing is the leading lines for placement under the front bezel which is visible if you're looking at the Note from the side or flat on its back.After wiping off all the paper flakes that came with the device and blowing air gently into the power port, the audio port (which has a HUGE hole compared to the Samsung Galaxy S3's audio port), I powered up the device. As with most devices, I figured it'd have a little power to turn on, but this one did not. I plugged it in and went about setting it up. Not thirty minutes out of the box and all the applications start crashing on me. They start to error out, unable to find location, unstable internet (which was fine according to my phone) and that google.services were unable to function.I pulled my hair out for a bit, read some Android forums and figured out how to do a manufacturer's reset. Everything appears to be working now, but that was a headache upon receiving it. Had I been an average user with no experience in computers/devices, I'd have shipped it back up in frustration and returned it. The blemish bothers the heck out of me, but I'd rather not have to receive another box of paper debris and risk getting a scratched screen, just for a cosmetic issue. Going to try it out for a few days, see how it does, then decide if I should return it.Update: Feb 13, 2014: Sitting with Samsung Support trying to get my device to load the Samsung App and Samsung Hub application to no avail. I have the apps on my Galaxy S3 Phone which work, but they aren't loading on my Note. They error out with "common error on product search" and "Service Unavailable (1009). Unable to find your location. Check your network settings and try again." Technician had me create a whole new Samsung account just to test the device, but it isn't loading either way.7:57 pm - Amazon is overnight shipping me a new Galaxy Note 10.1 (2014) edition after Samsung Technical Support suggested I replace it since it was brand new and malfunctioning. Amazon's customer service is amazing because I thought I'd have to wait a few days for a replacement. I already shipped the defective device back today, so I'm glad to see I'll have a new one in the mail tomorrow without the red blemish and hopefully without any WiFi/GPS connection problems that were messing up the Samsung App/Hub processes. Will update with another review when I receive the new device.Updated: Feb 14, 2014: Straight out of the box I noticed my replacement has a scratch on the bottom left silver bezel. The speaker cover plates are loose and jiggle when you move the Note around. You can tap them gently and they'll wiggle loose. The previous Note 10.1 (2014) did not have loose speaker plates, therefore I can't believe this is "working as intended" or was designed like this.Turning the Note on, it went through several updates unlike the previous Note, but still could not connect to Samsung Apps or Samsung Hub. In addition, this Note is hot to the touch unlike the previous one I replaced. I'm about ready to ask for a refund and try my luck with in-store purchases instead. This is ridiculous, the headache has made me reduce this by another star.Bonus Extras FYI: Dropbox will not give you the full 50GB of storage space if you have a pre-existing account. Any GB you earned from Referrals won't matter after you link it with your Bonus offer for Galaxy Perks.Update: Feb 15, 2014: Returned my device to Amazon through the pre-paid label. I asked for a refund to be issued. In the meantime, I went with Samsung's suggestion to purchase the Note from an "authorized" vendor, as apparently Amazon.com is not considered by them an authorized dealer (who knew?), and headed to Best Buy. The Samsung employees there hired to work at Best Buy listened to my story, they let me test the device right there with them. No scratches, no blemishes, no paper flakes in the package. Screen's protection sticker was absolutely fine without any debris in it like the first two I purchased from Amazon. Straight out of the package, it had a full charge, no problems getting it signed up on the Samsung account, updated, all the apps worked in the store. Device itself did not get burning hot to the touch like the second replacement I was sent. All the parts on it were in good working order, no loose pieces or otherwise visible defects. S-Pen worked like a charm, quick to respond to the button tap near the screen, worked flawlessly.My only problem with it was once I got home the Samsung Hub had an "unknown error" again and crashed. I'm wondering if the Samsung Hub itself isn't working properly and the server is dropping or if there's an issue with my router and the Note because the Samsung Galaxy S3 phone works fine on WiFi with the Samsung Hub application.Why am I so determined I wanted a Note 10.1 (2014) instead of an iPad Air when they're relatively the same price?The expandable memory for the SD card is one. The fact I can plug my Note into the computer via micro USB and retrieve files. It can NFC with my phone among other Samsung things. It has the ability to flawlessly render my handwriting into text format, port it (handwriting and all) to PDF format then send it to Evernote. There's the fact I can not only use the tablet for hand writing my notes, but I can also use it to draw sketches. It's definitely a useful device for someone who spends most of their day sketching, writing, or researching. The S-Pen permits you to take snapshots of whatever you're looking at and save it to a scrapbook backed up on the Samsung account you link your device with. You can also take a screen capture and doodle on it with the S-Pen then send it off to someone or save it.Since the device itself is 10.1 inches of real estate with the capacity of adjusting your stylus width/type you can virtually do whatever you need with S-Note. From using a pen, pencil, brush, various colors, types of lines, etc. I really wanted this without having to buy a stylus, multiple applications, and so forth. Dual window screen is great for someone trying to copy and paste data from an e-mail to another program or even just comparing information.So far I liked the price, the features available, and customization versus the high price and lack of expansion with the iPad.
Reviews.Title: UPDATED: Straight out of the Box...

Reviews.Author: Lou
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Samsung products and I currently own the Galaxy Note 3 and the original Note 10.1 tablet. When the 2014 edition of the Note came out, I was eager to explore the high resolution screen and the many features that make the Note such a great tablet. Being aware that the Note Pro 12.2 is about to be released, boasting of a larger screen size and a more windows-like display, I seriously thought of waiting to check out this larger tablet. However, trying to be practical, the Note 2014, for me, lighter-weight and slightly smaller in size (not screen size though), the portability of the tablet is really important to me. I bought the tablet a couple of days ago and am quite impressed and very happy with this product. I was able to sync the tablet, through my Samsung account (with MUCH help from my tech-savvy son) and to my surprise, was able to get all my saved S-Notes onto my new tablet. An app called File Manager, a free download from the play store, was needed and well utilized in making this transition possible. And on the Samsung website, an S-Note Reader program can be downloaded for free onto any PC, allowing you to read your S-Notes on your computer. Again, all credit goes to my son, whose patience for this is extraordinary. A lot of trial and error initially, along with some scary (I thought I lost ALL my S-Notes) and frustrating moments, it all worked out well in the end. I have barely begun to explore the many new and improved features of this tablet, and I was quite satisfied with the original Note 10.1 (which I happily passed along to my son). I rely heavily on the S-Note application to take many notes, create many folders, etc., both for business use (primarily) and for personal use as well. I LOVE the S-PEN, which now I cannot live without. While always attracted to the iPad with Retina Display, the lack of note-writing capability on the iPad and most other tablets, is a big disadvantage to me. The Surface Pro was also something I seriously considered, but with enough windows computers and being I am so very comfortable with the Note, I am sticking with this tablet. I also purchased the specially designed Samsung cover/case for this tablet, which I am also very happy with. It is really slick-looking and when you lift the cover open, it wakes up the tablet. All necessary ports are conveniently exposed. The screen resolution is beautiful, text is so easy to read and videos stand out beautifully. I was also able to install Adobe Flash Player from the Adobe website, which, for me, just ,makes life a lot easier. All the apps I had installed on my original Note 10.1 were automatically placed on the new tablet once I set it up. Wi-Fi connections work very well also, so I have no complaints so far. I will update this review if I come across any issues, but so far, so good. If you like Samsung products, I would highly recommend this tablet. Hope you enjoy it as much as I do.
Reviews.Title: IMPRESSIVE TABLET

Reviews.Author: Divot00
Reviews.Content: I have an IPAD 3 and have been satisfied with it but have always missed the capability for a stylus to write notes and when necessary convert to text.  The big fat rubber stylus lacking precision is not meeting the intent. I was very excited when Samsung came out with the Note 2 phone it met all my needs with great satisfaction except those times when I did want a bigger screen for viewing documents that need work.  I finally decided I would try out the Note 10.1 2014. I am very happy with the stylus and SNote app although I do have suggestions I will need to submit on the app s/w like the ability to import a pdf or other type of document to write on top of it and take notes within the original document.  I do this constantly with Microsoft OneNote.Pro:StylusMicro SD card slot - not a prisoner to Apple's lack of memory expansionBattery life very comparable to IpadItems for improvement:The hard home button and soft buttons are in the worst place and I constantly touch them and exit out of the app I am in.Retraining my hand positions will take time.  For me it is worth the trade off.As with every tablet we all have different features we want.  You will need to decide what makes you happy.This one is right down my alley.
Reviews.Title: Great Product

Reviews.Author: sylvia johnson
Reviews.Content: this tablet does everything. it's so fast' the color pops off the page. i'm so glad i bought this on amazon
Reviews.Title: love this tablet

Reviews.Author: Chris. C.
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable clarity.  I am still learning the control of the desktop but I find it much easier to use than an iPad.  Plus Samsung gives you the starting instructions you need to set up and get running.  As soon as the app world gets their focus off all things apple then we will see even greater utility from a great machine.  I am still waiting for the harden case folks to build the case I need to protect my notebook while piloting my airplane.
Reviews.Title: notebook 2014 a great tablet

Reviews.Author: book reader
Reviews.Content: I think I've owned about every tablet that has been made, and I must say the resolution and graphics and speed and weight is a heck of a lot better than all other ttabletsI had a problem deciding between the iPad air or the note.I chose the note because it has a lot more features than the ipad.For 650.00 you get a 96 gb tablet.which is not to bad.also must of your apps can now be moved to the SD card.also I have the note 3 which is just as good.
Reviews.Title: WOW Simply amazed

Reviews.Author: John Nichols
Reviews.Content: Screen, speed, and available memory.I replaced my original iPad, and was amazed at the difference.Pictures and text are better than my laptops, or even my 25" desktop monitor.
Reviews.Title: Big Step Up From My Original iPad

Reviews.Author: Ann Schwartz
Reviews.Content: It was everything that it was advertised to be. It takes a while to learn all of the functionality though.
Reviews.Title: Love my Galaxy

Reviews.Author: Jeewan K.
Reviews.Content: it works amazing. the s pen features very cool. can't wait for more apps to support it. I wud recommend this to anyone.
Reviews.Title: best tab ever

Reviews.Author: Steven Brown
Reviews.Content: Not everything I ever wanted, but I'm very happy with it.Pros:- S-Pen is amazing.  I don't think I'll ever go back to anything but s-pens.  The Samsung apps that utilize the s pen are also good.  I wish there were a setting so whenever the pen is removed, only the pen will touch buttons and not the finger or hand.  They have that partially in some apps.- SD card. In the app options, it says you can move apps to the SD card, but I'm not sure how to verify that it works.  A warning: when I checked out, Amazon recommended a 64GB micro sd card.  The specifications say it only accepts 32GB.  I bought a Samsung 32GB, so I haven't tested whether 64GB works, but I wouldn't risk it.  I bought a Samsung micro SD card because it's faster than SanDisc.- Great speakers.  I'm a musician, and was worried about complaints others made, but I think they're great.  I mean, they're not exactly surround sound, but what do you expect from a tablet?  It's loud enough and clear enough for my purposes.- Good camera.  I'm no photographer, but I thought the camera was a good quality.- Thin and light.  I haven't had much experience with tablets, but I was happy with the size.- Great perks.  I don't know how long they'll offer the perks, but I got good stuff like DropBox space, Google Play credit, credit toward entertainment in the Samsung Hub, etc.- The IR blaster is cool (TV remote), but it's hard to find a good app that uses it.  I finally found one, but it was a long search.- Big screen with good quality.  If you like to watch movies in the dark, you might want to turn the brightness auto adjust off, because in the dark, the screen also goes dark.  For movies, that usually doesn't work too well.  When you turn the brightness to your liking, the quality is great.- I also like that you can have two apps side by side, or mini floating window apps.  Not all apps can do these - actually most can't, but many of the important ones can.Neutral/Maybe:- The pen is small to hold, but that is to be expected.- There are other tablets with 64GB + SD card.  I'm not close to running out of space yet, but I like to have it just to have it.- I'd like to see better power options.  There is a power saving mode you can turn on and off.  My phone has options to keep the screen on when it's plugged in.  I'd like that for the tablet.  I'd also like it to turn power saving mode off when it's plugged in, and perhaps turn power saving mode on when it's not plugged in.  When it's fully charged, it displays a message saying to unplug it from the charger.  From my reading, it's just an odd attempt at being green.- The speed is what I expected.  It hasn't really lagged too much.  You have to change a setting so the screen rotates faster.  Just remember that it is a tablet, not a computer.  In general remember that.  If you want to type, use a keyboard.  A tablet is for portability, but bigger and fancier than a smartphone.Cons:- I haven't been that happy with the Samsung software and apps.  They haven't been what the videos say they are.  I have a Samsung laptop, but I can't stream video to it like I though I could.  Unless you have the right Samsung TV or box, don't plan on streaming movies or pictures to your TV.- Along with the last complaint, there is no HDMI port.  There are adapters for other models, but not for this one.- When you press home when you're already home, it takes you to read the news.  You can't change this option.  I'm sorry to say, I'm not that interested in the news.  I keep pressing it by mistake, and having to go back.  I wish you could choose which app that shortcut would open.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet.  Very happy.

Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: I use this tablet as an artist, for drawing and painting and various Graphic Design projects. As a Graphic Design student I cannot express how useful this tablet is. The pen uses a Wacom digitizer. Instead of hauling my Wacom tablet to class every day, I just take the tablet to create digital works, which I can then port to Photoshop, Illustrator, or whatever. The stylus is far superior to those which work with an iPad, and you save money by having a stylus that is built in to this tablet. If you are an artist or an art student looking for a tablet that will increase your productivity I highly suggest the Note over the iPad. I know that Apple computers are the industry standard in the Art world, but this tablet should be the exception to that "rule". Art kids, abandon your Apple tablets and get yourself a Note.Speaking of Note! The note taking capabilities of this tablet are amazing. For once, I'm an organized note taker. I have abandoned the lined paper notebook and I use this tablet solely for note taking in my Art History classes. I love how I can drag pictures into my notes, which is absolutely a bonus, and an important feature in helping me learn Art History. Instead of having to download a huge PDF with slides from a lecture on art, and flip through my paper notebook to find the corresponding artworks, I just drag the artworks over into my notes and everything is right there. It's awesome!This tablet is very fast, very snappy, and responsive. I have no issues at all with it's speed. Even when running many apps at once, and while using a custom launcher app, it's still fast.I love this thing. I am incredibly happy with my purchase. I literally cannot imagine my life without this thing, now that I've had it for a few months. It is an integral part to my education and my life. I should do commercials for Samsung. :)
Reviews.Title: Far superior to an iPad

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Sean Holder Photography"
Reviews.Content: So here's my take on this tablet:1. The additional items that Samsung is playing up in their advertisement as being $600 of free stuff, is complete garbage. The $50 credit they give you for the Samsung hub is a joke, the bookstore has nothing worth purchasing except garbage books, the App Store that Samsung has is complete joke also. The only added value is the 25 dollar credit with Google Play. Everything else you're going to get a free trial and then they want you to get a subscription with a monthly fee. So it's a complete marketing scam by Samsung to get you to buy this tablet.2. Okay now is the tablet worth $550 for the 32mb version? I would say yes.3. The other reason I do not rate this a five star is because its not running the latest version of Android. You would think, at least I would think, that if this is your flag ship model that research and development would have worked endless hours to give you the latest updated edition since its release last year. But no it's still running Androd Jelly Bean 4.3 which is not a bad thing but when you're spending this kind of money you would expect a and company like Samsung to be at the top of their game.4. Why did I pick Samsung over the iPad? The biggest reason I got this tablet was because of the stylus s-pen verses touch only types of tablet. If Apple had a tablet with a stylus with Wacom technology similar to this one I more than likely I would have gone with the iPad, reason being is their updates seem to come out faster from their R&D; division. For some reason Android products seem to be hit or miss on whether you're going to get an update or not or if you do get the update it takes forever, this tablet was released October 2013 and it still does not have the KitKat update for Android how ridiculous is that.5. So how does the tablet work? After I purchased the tablet I went to the Samsung store and I purchased the Bluetooth keyboard and the USB adapter. I have to say this almost works as good as a laptop with the keyboard and the USB adapter. I am able to plug in my portable 2tb external hard drive by Western Digital, this is a huge plus being a photographer that this little tablet can actually power my external hard drive for when I want to show images to clients. Again the keyboard is an awesome addition if you wanna sit and type something verses using the S-pen or finger typing.Final note, I'm going to give this tablet a chance and hope the updates come out soon and the biggest test is going to see if later this year probably several several months from now when Android 4.5 is released if this tablet gets updated to that version. The last thing I want to do is be spending this type of money every year and a half to two years when a new update for Android comes out and the company doesn't support the upgrades. I have that issue with Toshiba Thrive 10 inch tablet this was a very promising tablet but once they got to Android Ice Cream Sandwich version they stopped. There were no more updates, no more support which was truly disappointing since I really enjoyed the Toshiba company. But when companies do not take care of their clients, the ones that support them they will lose them. Case in point as for me I will never purchase a Toshiba item again, I am currently very very happy with this Samsung tablet.Does this tablet have value that an Apple iPad air does not have? Yes it certainly does the multi task window is a huge feature that Apple would probably need to learn to implement into their tablet. The s-pen is huge the Wacom technology is spot on I've been using a Wacom tablet to edit my photos on my computer for several several years and to have this feature on a tablet is awesome.So again to recap the added value that Samsung is pushing on their advertisement that you get this supposedly $600 in extra stuff is a complete scam in my eyes. To me the value is only really $25 for the Google Play Store other than that everything else is a waste.Will I keep this tablet? Definitely it's a great tablet let's see how soon Samsung can get there research and development team together and get it updated, and keep it updated with the latest versions of the Android software and not take 6 or more months from release date and have you still waiting for the update and at the same time call this their top of the line model when its not even running the most current Android software.
Reviews.Title: Top of the Line Tablet, Mediocre Samsung Support

Reviews.Author: C. Steinbrecher "CWS"
Reviews.Content: I got my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1" 2014 edition one week ago.  Intent was to transition my iPad to my wife who is comfortable with her iPhone and me to adopt the Galaxy Note as I really like my Galaxy S3 phone and am looking for maximum compatibility.  I have been exceptionally pleased.  More and more I belive that the Apple products, while they do have some very nice features, just seem to lock you out of too many things.  For example, try transporting your Apple address book somewhere else, good luck with that.  The google address book gives you so much more flexibility and power.The screen on the Galaxy Note is incredible.  The form factor being a little wider is also generally very nice.  Some Aps although do not scale quite as well to this - for example my application to read the San Diego Union Tribune seems to be sized more for the iPad - not a huge deal though.The internet browser on the Galaxy Note seems superior to me.  It just works better and seems to support more websites and particularly video formats that you can not view on the iPad.Love how you can install your own micro SD memory card in the Samsung products.  You can buy a good quality 64Gb microSD for a fraction of what Apple charges you to get 64Gb of memory.EMail Ap provided with the Galaxy Note is very nice and easy to use.GPS Receiver Built In - very nice built-in GPS receiver.  My iPad2 does not have this.  Don't know if the more recent iPads do or not.  Works very well and of course integrates great with hte GoogleMaps and since this is an Android device no problems there.  You do need wireless access for your maps to update as you move around the country but I did find a free Ap that allows you to download maps for free (Navigator) that appears a good option.Dropbox - Samsung gives you 2 years subscription with 50Gb storage to Dropbox.  I am very impressed with the ease of use of Dropbox on the Samsung Galaxy Note as well as my home laptop.  I can even look up files from my work computer network by just logging into my dropbox account.  This is very convenient.In general, I am thrilled with my Galaxy Note 10.1 2014.  It is generally very intuitive and I find it to be more powerful in many ways than the iPad.  Did I mention the ability to open a second application to the side or in a subwindow - very convenient at times.  There are a few drawbacks compared to the Apple iPad which I will list below.  - Ap Support - the application availablity for the Galaxy Note is excellent but not as good as for Apple.  If you have a popula Ap on your Apple device I would estimate an 80% probability the Ap will be available on the Androis as well.  But there have been some supriises.  I have been running an Ap on my iPad and Galaxy S3 Phone to track my NCAA mens basketball bracket and mysteriously it does not seem to be available for the Galaxy Note.  Similarly, my Glo Bible ap is not yet available but they say they are working on it.  Also, can't find an Ap for Amazon Prime  video although there is one to play Amazon prime video on the iPad.  Hopefully Amazon will get one available soon for the Android.  - Music Transferability - this is both a negative and a positive.  If you have all your music in Apple iTunes it will take a little work to transfer into the Android system.  That said, Apple iTunes I find to be too restrictive and I'm trying to move away from them.  There are aps and utilities out there that can do this for you.  - Picture Transferability - Apple does a very nice job with it's iPhoto program and then transfers all of your albums seamlessly to your iPad and/or iPhone.  That said, it appears that Google's Picasa can now import your iPhoto albums.  I will be trying to make that transition but I do have to complement Apple on the ease of use of their iPhoto program between their devices.After one week I am thrilled with the Samsung Galaxy Note and highly recommend it.  I find it worth the transition away from Apple and with just a little bit of work will be more powerful and convenient than the iPad was.
Reviews.Title: Beats iPad

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I am currently in college right now and this tablet has become essential for my day to day life at school. It is great for taking notes reading books in pdf form (an app is required for this though). The tablet also works great for checking email making last minute changes to a paper with Polaris or office suite along with skydrive.
Reviews.Title: Great for students in college

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I know there are over 600 reviews for the Note 10.1 2014 but I wanted to put my 2 cents in. I have the original Galaxy Tab 10.1 GT-P7510 that I got two years ago and liked it but it was buggy and slooow and would have to re-boot a lot. I decided I wanted to upgrade and get something I could multi-task with and have good battery life.I read and watched reviews and settled on the Note 2014 32G. I got it the 1st week of January and have used it every day I've had it. I have read some people had lag problems or battery drain problems but I have not any problems with anything. I did install Nova Launcher Prime (I had it on my Tab) and use Chrome browser. My Note is fast and smooth. Very snappy when I swipe and change apps. I'm not a game player so I can't address that but I have watched movies on it and the screen is awesome and movie play is flawless.Typical for me is: I can read a magazine, a few chapters of a book, watch a few YouTubes, play around with the S-Pen while listening to some music, surf the web, surf Amazon and place an order, check email and Facebook and do a couple of lessons of an on-line course and general messing around and still have 1/3 of the battery left at the end of the day. I can easily go a couple of days with a battery charge. I was lucky to get a day on my Tab 10.1 with less use. I usually plug it in at night while I sleep but there have been times that I want to top the battery off and it seems to charge fairly quick.I use this tablet every day and really enjoy using it. I bought the Samsung smart case and also use FlexArmorX pouch because I take it with me when I go to work and when I travel.I do wish Samsung made it easier to sync stuff from one device to another. I'm still trying to get files from my Tab to my Note but that's a Samsung issue, not a Note 2014 issue. I would recommend the Note 10.1 2014 to anyone wanting a fast, powerful and pleasure to use tablet. There is a learning curve but that's part of the experience. I did buy and download "Samsung Galaxy Tabs for Dummies" by Dan Gookin. Copyright 2014. It covers all Galaxy Tabs and the Note. It's $10 from Amazon and I have learned some good and helpful stuff. I would recommend it whether you're new to tabs or, like me, have had an older tab.
Reviews.Title: Great tab.

Reviews.Author: V. Quinlan
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that we are huge Apple fans from way back.  I gave my husband an iPad for Christmas, and he's very happy with it.  I was looking specifically for a tablet with a port for an SD card so that I could take the card from my camera and pop the photo's directly into my tablet.  This is one of the few tablets with an SD port - the iPad does not, so it wasn't even on my short list.I love that the tablet plays nicely with my camera, but it does so many more amazing things that were happy surprises.  I particularly like the S pen functions - scrapbook is a great way to keep track of recipe's I want to put on my menu plan for the week or DIY projects I want to try.  I even used it to take pictures of haircuts that I liked to show to my hairdresser - very handy feature.  S note is great for grocery lists, reminders, and idea's that I would otherwise loose track of.As far as speed goes, I'm absolutely pleased with the speed of all of the tasks I use it for.  Quick surfing, video's play well, and the screen is rich and amazing.  The sound isn't great, though, but we paired it with a little Jam bluetooth speaker or the Bose speakers in our RV and it works great.There are lots of tips and tricks available on Samsung.com to help you get the most out of this tablet.  I've found them very helpful.  I'm really happy with my tablet choice - it does everything I would want it to, is light and easily portable, the battery life is more than enough, and it's very user friendly.  Combined with the ability to expand with the SD card, it's an easy top pick.
Reviews.Title: SO much more than the iPad

Reviews.Author: Jakob S.
Reviews.Content: I must first start out by saying that I had the note 10.1 2012 version before purchasing this one and I have been pleased with all of the Samsung products that I have.The display is amazing compared to the old note 10.1. I am out and about all day every day for work and school and always have my tablet with me for quick notes, or if I have some extra time, for watching movies. The display was the main reason I got this tablet.I compared and contrasted this display with my iPad 3rd generation which has the retina display, as well as compared it to the old note 10.1. One of the problems that I had with the Note 10.1 2012 was that it always had an awful glare especially when I was outside or in a room with a lot of windows or with lot of light. It killed me because the old note was very powerful but the screen always had a very annoying glare. The screen on the old note 10.1 was also not as sensitive to the touch as my iPad 3 did. The speakers on the old note were not as good as the iPad 3 either. But with the new note 10.1 2014, Samsung really nailed everything right on the head. The screen on the new note 10.1 2014 outperforms the note 10.1 2012 by a long shot. The screen is brighter and way more vivid. It is also a lot more sensitive to the touch. Those annoying glares that I always got with the note 10.1 2012 were gone. I also noticed that the speakers were significantly louder than the ipad 3 and the note 10.1 2012, but the ipad had a lot more bass it it's speakers.One problem that I had with the iPad, as a student, was that it was somewhat difficult to take notes while in class. There really aren't any very good word processors made for the iPad. The note 2014 comes with Polaris Office which is really similar to Microsoft Word. It is a fully functioning word processor. What I like most is that through Polaris Office, you can set it up to save all of your documents straight to google drive so that your documents can be synced to all of your devices. For example: I start an essay in class and save it; when I get home, I can continue working on it on my computer; then when I am on the bus I can read it on my Note 3 cell phone. You can make word, excel, and even powerpoint presentations right there on your tablet. I purchased a keyboard case for it and paired with my Razer Orochi bluetooth mouse, it is nearly a computer!While using a bluetooth mouse and a bluetooth keyboard with the wifi and bluetooth on all the time, this tablet lasts me all day and even into the next day for a little if I forget to charge it. And because it is so small and light, it is very easy to carry around all day rather than having to carry a bulky laptop.Another useful feature is the app Watch-on. Because the note 10.1 2014 has an IR sensor in it, you can pretty much control anything that uses an IR remote. I have it set up with my 42" TV, my bluray player, my cable box, and my receiver. I did find the app somewhat difficult to use sometimes because you can pretty much only use it when your line of sight is directly above the tablet and since you have to line up to IR sensor to your TV when you want to change the channel, sometimes you don't always hit the right buttons.Another thing I use it for a lot is for music. I am involved in the Millennial Choral Organizations in Mesa, AZ which requires that I memorize a lot of music in a relatively short period of time. I just take a picture of the music using one of the Cam Scan apps and save it as a PDF until the end of the semester when I delete it all. Part of having all of this music is having to write notes on how the conductor wants it to sound. One thing I was a little disappointed in was that it does not have the capability of writing notes on the PDF and then saving them. But what I figured out is that you can select free write after you pull out the s-pen and then I can write my notes on it and it saves it as a screenshot. I wish that it had the capabilities to do write on the PDF, but unfortunately, you cant.Overall it is a great and powerful tablet.
Reviews.Title: A tablet made for students and musicians as well as for media lovers

Reviews.Author: Jeffry J. Brickley
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews of this product (or at least a large portion) to fully understand why the mixed rating and did I want to take the risk or not. $600 was a huge investment for me on the risk of new technology. HOWEVER, I bought this after all the updates were out, and things were already looking better. You can see the line in the reviews for when this happened. This is customary for new technology. I have had a rooted kindle and have had helped others with an iPad, but I really wanted something that was Android and good enough to use many of the features of my phone on a pad (I have a Samsung S4, near enough to the technology in this product to sway the purchase).Snote is working much better since the update. Most of the other technology is working really good. I have not removed the Knox interface as many have threatened (and some have done). The primary reason is update path. I am still waiting for a good bluetooth keyboard case for this and I want the update path so far. That does not mean I may stick with it forever, but I actually use the Knox interface to split my business/home use. This is very handy. I have packed this pad with goodies and it's still going strong. I use both the Spen and a standard pad stylus from my roocase purchased at the same time. The Spen actually has the detail/resolution to grab the timesheet program interface bar that is buggy on a mobile interface (it gets squashed).The camera has less resolution than my S4, but actually has slightly better light and color response. I have not used the front facing camera and am unlikely to in the near future. I am just not a visual chat person.All in all this pad is stable in the current update mark and operates fast and efficiently for everything that I do. As a returning student I look forward to how this pad can help in both work and school organization.
Reviews.Title: A great product that finally stablized in it's update releases.

Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: After years of research, I can say this is one of the better deals, if not the best, for someone who wants to draw or paint on a tablet. The version of Sketchbook made for the tablet, which comes for free, is feature rich (layers, layer controls, pressure sensitive brushes, rulers, symmetries etc.) and pretty easy to figure out, even coming from Photoshop. You will have to learn a new style of doing things, as your capabilities will be stripped down a lot, but the simplicity can be a muse of sorts.The $25 credit you get when you register the device can help get you a few more choice programs for your artistic needs. I recommend Sketchbook Ink as well. I had a lot of trouble finding reviews with artists' opinions, so I figured I'd throw one on here to help any other amateurs like me!
Reviews.Title: An artist's dream of a tablet.

Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Carter
Reviews.Content: This was purchased to replace a two year old tablet that was getting too slow.  It is a great tablet with plenty of storage space and seem to be very fast.  It fits my needs exactly.
Reviews.Title: Samsung 2014

Reviews.Author: Guillermo
Reviews.Content: Such a greta tablet especially because I wanted to do some handwriting when taking notes rather than stroking keys. I love and now I take it everywhere.
Reviews.Title: It met my expectations

Reviews.Author: Gadget Nut "RichR"
Reviews.Content: This is the fastest tablet I have used to date. With a 5gb WiFi connection it is super fast. The screen resolution is excellent and the multi-window feature really comes in handy.
Reviews.Title: Best table I have owned,

Reviews.Author: Deos
Reviews.Content: It does absolutely everything I want it to. With a large SD card, it is a great replacement for my laptop. If you want a high end tablet, this is a great deal. The TV remote is awesome, the internal power is enough to whatever you throw at it. The battery life is surprisingly long for a screen of this quality.
Reviews.Title: Great Purchase

Reviews.Author: Nicklas Williams
Reviews.Content: The tablet arrived properly packaged with all the accessories.  This is a great price for a new product (discounted for refurbished)
Reviews.Title: Great price

Reviews.Author: Hope Hankin
Reviews.Content: I ordered this and had Bluetooth problems right away...Samsung tech support was NOT helpful (hence my 4 star instead of 5 star review) and indicated that my Bluetooth keyboard was not a Samsung and so may be the problem.  One tech guy however had mentioned it was PERHAPS a firmware problem, so after getting frustrated with Samsung I went to Best Buy with my tablet and the Bluetooth keyboard, and their floor item and all other Samsung devices worked wonderfully with my keyboard.  I bought a replacement from them and I am returning this particular tablet to Amazon.  It is NOT Amazon's fault that they item was defective and I have a few more days to get this returned, which is a policy I love (it took me almost the full 30 days to sort all this out).  As for the Tablet itself, although I detest working with Samsung as a customer service company, their products please me and I will continue to use them as long as they stay at the top of the consumer reports ratings.
Reviews.Title: Not reviewing the tablet I bought!  It was broken! But I got a new one.

Reviews.Author: Whitney Clark
Reviews.Content: The wifi is not all that great and is a little slow to respond.  Makes drawing a little difficult.However, it is sleek and light weight:)
Reviews.Title: Wifi is not that great

Reviews.Author: Hawkins "Biggs"
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Samsung products and especially the S Pen! I own the Note 2 and using both are a joy. My only wish is that I could get a little better performance and less bloat without resorting to rooting it.
Reviews.Title: Wish it had less bloat

Reviews.Author: A. wilson "immortalhighlander"
Reviews.Content: I didn't have enough money to purchase a new laptop computer.  So I researched tablets.  It was either this or the Apple Ipad Air.  It all came down to memory.  Can I upgrade?  The answer was simple, Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014.  The cameras on this are and will be helpful for what I need.  Great product, highly encourage people to research tablets before purchasing them.  But you won't find a better one with a 10.1 inch screen than this.
Reviews.Title: Wow and wow

Reviews.Author: Patricia A. Huff
Reviews.Content: I bought the Ibook and returned it for the Galaxy. I love the way it has more, does more, and is simple to use.  Simplicity in the use allows more time to enjoy the extras. This is one thing Apple has never proven to me to do, KISS,  keep it simple stupid.
Reviews.Title: KISS

Reviews.Author: Watchin
Reviews.Content: It's fast, reliable, handles all my apps, and the remote control is great. I was able to replace a broken remote for the media box without a glitch, this has become the control panel for tv, set box, media player, blueray, picture display, and sound system. The remote app is a bit over advertise oriented, but I can ignore all that junk (the missing star). Comes with a lot of cramware but it can be deleted and uninstalled. With the poetic cover it's immediate on-off when you open/close the cover. The stylus is nice, especially when web browsing (small text and icons), but I haven't found a use for the handwriting app.The only real problem is the lack of a driver/support for the Dell 1160w printer in Directprint, but that's a Dell issue as the supplied one doesn't work in 4.3
Reviews.Title: Rugged, solid, fast, works...

Reviews.Author: Wayne Carr
Reviews.Content: I've had my Galaxy Note 10.1 (2014 edition) for a 5 weeks now.It's a great tablet ... does everything as advertised, and I especially like its size and light weight.I often take it with me to the gym so I can listen to music AND read a book while using the cardio machines.My only negative issue is that my Galaxy Note is weak when it comes to wireless performance.I often use my tablet in a room that is a fair distance from my wireless router, and my Note 10.1 can't seem to hold a connection to my wireless network from that location. I purchased the Note to replace my first generation iPad, which has never had a problem with my wireless network from that room.I enjoy my Galaxy Note immensely, but I guess I'll be keeping the iPad around so I can still access my wireless network, and the internet from my favorite, relaxation room.p.s. Yes, I've tried a wireless extender, but every one I've tried seems to overheat and shut itself off at least once or twice a day.  Guess I'll have to consider moving my wireless router to a more "house central" location ... which is problematic since its current location is, of necessity, close to the cable modem.
Reviews.Title: Light, Bright, Sharp, and Way Cool ... but,

Reviews.Author: Cobalt TiNor
Reviews.Content: I bought the SGN 10.1 about two months ago in electronic retail giants store. I have been waiting for my first impression to wear off before I wrote this review, and it has. The reason I bought this tablet is that I was contemplating getting a laptop, for school, despite how much I dislike laptops.I bought this tablet knowing that it had the stylus (pen) and it had handwriting recognition. All store models I had used were all very fast and responsive. My handwriting is unlike anyone else's that I have seen. In the years past, devices with handwriting recognition were not able to read my writing. They required I write in a specific manner.  Also previous devices required that I write one letter or word at a time. All the store models of the Samsung Galaxy were able to read my handwriting. The Samsung Galaxy allows me to write more than a sentence at one time. It also reads it and processes it quickly, as well as gets better at recognizing my writing the more I use it.With the apps, the web capabilities, the speed, the responsiveness, the handwriting recognition, this tablet has become my school workhouse. I really do not feel I need a laptop anymore. Like anything, the Samsung Galaxy has it's shortcomings, and there are a few. But at the moment, the only shortcoming worth mentioning is the ram. Even with 3gb of ram, and the responsiveness, I feel that it needs more memory. I constantly see my memory usage at 2.74gb. I constantly make sure that I close apps instead of just minimizing them, because i'm always maxing out the memory.And just the OS alone seems to take up 1.23gb of the 3gb of ram, because at boot up, the memory usage is never less. No matter how many apps I close, or memory I clear I cannot remember it ever showing less in memory in use.I am not an apple fan although I have used their devices many times. I have owned the Blackberry Playbook in lieu of an iPad. But this tablet is the best tablet I have ever used to date.
Reviews.Title: Highly productive tablet

Reviews.Author: Erick R
Reviews.Content: After 3 days using it the tablet started failing on booting.I contacted Samsung Technical support twice and applied the recommended troubleshooting. It did'nt work.I am very frustrated.
Reviews.Title: It only worked for 3 days!! I am returning it

Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: Amazing!  The resolution is beyond amazing.  So far everything I have done with it is beyond what I expected!  The note taking is great.  Just need to learn to convert it to text.  Time to hit the manual!
Reviews.Title: Got this today

Reviews.Author: Iryna
Reviews.Content: I'v got everything I expected to get from this tablet. Exellent quality. Im very happy. Its my Birthday present. :)
Reviews.Title: The best tablet

Reviews.Author: The Bobinator
Reviews.Content: My only gripe is the S-note feature is a little quirky.  I bought it for the pen and am glad I did.  It lets me go completely paperless.
Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet

Reviews.Author: Nathan Haines
Reviews.Content: After working with the Manager, I was able to resolve all issues. Unfortunately, there was a variety of miscommunications with both parties. The manager and owner worked hard to ensure I was satisfied and I apologize for reacting so quickly. I would recommend this company to my friends and family.
Reviews.Title: Retraction of Previous Review. Excellent Customer Follow Up

Reviews.Author: chapajong prisco
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable tablet out there.Excellent brilliant screen and super fast performance.I love it much cus i do all i want.Standard multitasking and all the rest.pls lay ur hands on this tablet and u will find the sweetnest we who already owned one are sweeting in.Samsung u are number one.Nice Tabet.
Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet in all aspects.u will not regret buying this piece of golden machine

Reviews.Author: SEAN SEEBRAN
Reviews.Content: I really was not planning on making this purchase as I already own a Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 which I like a lot but being tempted by the specifications of this 2014 edition (Beautiful Screen, Speed, Size etc.) and also taking into consideration that my older daughter was encouraging me to make the purchase so she could get her hands on my Note 10.1, I finally decided to do the deed.The one thing that I was worried about was the placement of the speakers, I liked the speakers facing forward on the older model which is a rear feature on tablets but after playing the same videos and music on both, side by side, I was pleasantly surprised that the Note 10.1 2014 edition's side firing speakers were actually louder, clearer and has better stereo separation than the front facing speakers of the previous model.Another plus was the fact that I can now print directly from my note 10.1 2014 edition using my HP Printer, gone are the days of having to also purchase a Samsung printer just to print from your tablet, this is a great move by Samsung.This tablet is a great performer, the only two little negatives that I can think about is the fact that:(1) I don't know if it's my mind playing tricks on me but it seems to me that the 2014 edition's battery drains a little faster than the model before it. I think I'll do a little test by fully charging both then playing the same movie on both with brightness set to half and I'll post the results for those who are interested.(2) I've also noticed a very little light-bleed particularly at the bottom of the screen while watching a movie with the black band at top and bottom, this is in no way a deal breaker as you will hardly ever notice this.UPDATE 18/12/2013:After going a little deeper with my comparison between my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 (16GB, White) and Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (32GB, White), I've come to a few conclusions.Test 1:I streamed the movie "Olympus Has Fallen" from Netflix with both tablets playing at the same time "in sync", I started with both tablets at 100% battery charge, 50% brightness and 50% volume level and at the end of the movie credits, the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 (16GB, White) was at 64% battery life while the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (32GB, White) was at 57% battery life, a 7% difference. By the way, when looking at the same picture, movie etc. on both tablets side by side, the older tablet has a noticeably bluish hue as opposed to the newer model which shows more vibrant natural colors.Test 2:I continued using both tablets until they reached the 50% battery level then I started the charging process while timing on a stopwatch. The Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 (16GB, White) took 2:40 to charge from 50%, while the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (32GB, White) took 3:13 to charge from 50%, a 33 minute difference.All in all I love this tablet, the resolution of this screen is something to behold, everything looks so much better and words are much clearer and I'm really impressed with the sound quality and processor speed. I'm happy that I made the purchase, can't wait to see what Samsung comes up with next in the Note 10.1 line, hope this helps a little.Pros: Realistic color, screen is bright and beautiful, great sounding speakers, can print with my hp printer via wifi.Cons: little light bleed around edges but nothing to talk about.
Reviews.Title: Even Better Than I Expected After Testing Both 10.1 Models

Reviews.Author: Christine M Bell
Reviews.Content: I went into a retail store and checked out this tablet in person before I chose to buy on Amazon. I was blown away by the screen display, the size and the functionality of this tablet. I found it very easy to use and adding an SD card was SO easy! After reviewing the tablet in person, I sold my iPad 2 and bought this...and I very happy that I did!
Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet!

Reviews.Author: Thorough Review
Reviews.Content: I debated about this or the larger 12.2 unit for more money. In the end, I returned this one and went for the larger one. I'd rather see larger readable type than sharper images. But that's not why I returned it. I bought mine used thinking I'd save a few bucks. I learned that wasn't a good idea when I went to register it with Samsung. The unit was apparently registered by someone else and, upon trying to register it, I was told I was out of luck on claiming any of the perks -- like a $25 Google Play credit and multi-year free access to several services. I'd have to login using the original credentials, which, of course, I don't have. Not only that, if I want to use the Google "find my device" service, I can't because it's not registered in my account. I'm a bit concerned that whomever did register it could also activate the "erase all data" option and wipe me out. So I'm not too sure about buying things like tablets through the warehouse. I didn't discover until I was getting ready to pack it up that it was missing the S-Pen as well.
Reviews.Title: Very nice unit with a sharp, clear display

Reviews.Author: Maui Time
Reviews.Content: It crashed on me a couple of times the first two hours I played with it. The unlock screen can be a bit touchy. It is not quite as simple and easy as an iPad. It's not a good tablet for your Grandma. I would recommend it for anyone in business or familiar with android already.
Reviews.Title: Business Tablet

Reviews.Author: Cook
Reviews.Content: This is my third Android Tablet (after the Motorola Xoom and Asus Transformer Infinity).  As you would probably expect from a newer device, this tablet is much nicer than my previous two.  It does all of the standard stuff like e-mail and web browsing very well, but where this tablet really sets itself apart is with the pen features.  Being able to accurate write on the screen has allowed this to be the first tablet that I can really use for note taking at meetings at work.My only complaint is with some of the software that comes pre-installed on the tablet.  I just don't have any use for some of it, but Samsung has the tablet configured where you can't uninstall most of the pre-installed stuff.
Reviews.Title: Great Android Tablet

Reviews.Author: Rob Reinhardt "Licensed Professional Counselo...
Reviews.Content: I previously owned an ASUS Transformer Prime that I was quite happy with.  In fact, there were only two reasons I bought a new tablet:  1) I have a strong need to use a tablet for hand written notes and  2) the Transformer Prime camera had failed on me for the third time in the two years I had owned it (it apparently was a major design flaw on that tablet).  I loved the dockable keyboard, speed and everything else about the Transformer otherwise.Still, when I unboxed the note, I was immediately impressed with its speed, beautiful screen, and form factor.  I do find myself missing things like the HDMI port, but was able to easily remedy the keyboard situation by getting an inexpensive case with built-in bluetooth keyboard.  The Note responds well and quickly, even when running multiple applications.  The handwriting experience has been excellent, especially once I purchased the larger stylus (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B009PJN1U8/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1)  Battery life is nothing stellar but is acceptable.  Another thing I miss about the Prime is the extended battery life from the keyboard.The only two significant 'gripes' I have about the Note are:1) The built-in Samsung apps.  They get in the way.2) The placement of the Menu/Home/Back buttons.  Rather than being left to be displayed by the OS (appropriately placed based on the tablet orientation), they are part of the perimeter of the tablet.  I don't know whether Samsung didn't really think this through or just assumed/hoped that people would use the tablet in landscape orientation 99% of the time.  Perhaps because of the screen size they didn't want any of it taken up.  Regardless of their reasoning, I disagree with it.  It's unlike the vast majority of other Android devices in this respect and not for good reason.
Reviews.Title: Satisfied, Not Blown Away As I'd Hoped

Reviews.Author: Judd
Reviews.Content: very good resolution, very fast, very responsive touch pad, takes HD pictures and video, I like the large screen, has gotten high ratings and it lives up to them.
Reviews.Title: Fast tablet

Reviews.Author: Scheli
Reviews.Content: Pro's:The Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition, can pair with the Chromecast HDMI device and turns your Note/TV into a home theater.Battery Life seems to be 9 to 10 hours (This ishooked to the Chromecast and watching Netflix, not hooked up to the power supply)The camera, (I did not get it for this reason but, a good bonus) takes great pictures, indoors and outdoors.Con's:The only issue I have is, Samsung Hub does not pair with Chromecast, and the movies I have through that program is viewed only on a single person basis and not through the TV. (I think Samsung Hub should have the Chromecast pairing feature)
Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (16GB, Black)

Reviews.Author: Riccardo Manzotti
Reviews.Content: 4 stars because it could be somewhat less expensive, plus we are still waiting for the KitKat update. Excellent pen, gorgeous display, good touch screen. Sometimes, inexplicably laggy.
Reviews.Title: very good tablet

Reviews.Author: Chris In Jersey
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Note 10.1 2014 for writing using the S Pen. Putting this review out there for people like me who are looking for a tablet that will allow you two write on the screen and convert it to text into a document. While the S Pen can be used to hand write text on the screen in a few ways, for a writer, there isn't an easy way to use this feature. You can use the S Pen in their included Notes app but all handwritten text must be selected and then converted to text - not ideal. This app also requires pages to be the size of the screen which means if you keep writing you'll need to add a new page - no text flow to additional pages. This set up seems designed for the note taker, not a writer.I was not able to get the S Pen to even allow for handwritten entries into Google Drive documents or any other proper document app.The S Pen can be used to hand write and auto convert to text within GMail - but that is hardly useful to a writer of an article or book.Ultimately I had to return the tablet as it did not meet my main need. There was also a bit of a lag on functions - as an example if you have two windows browser tabs open, go to the 2nd and then go back to the first - that page would need to reload. Haven't seen that happen on other tablets and not even on my Samsung Galaxy phone.Pros: The screen does look great. Touch response is excellent. The S Pen used as a cursor worked perfectly.Cons: S Pen support limited within Apps. Handwritten to Text feature not good for writers of large documents (prob. ideal for note takers). Some slowness at odd times that shouldn't happen in a device at this price.
Reviews.Title: Writer's Review

Reviews.Author: Amer Syed "Devil may cry"
Reviews.Content: it does what my samsung s4 does, besides making phone calls. its a great piece of equipment, got it for my wife , the higher contract and the pen are very helpful, no smidges on the screen as you dont have to tuch the screen. and the camera has all the features of the phone as well
Reviews.Title: def the tablet to go

Reviews.Author: Eric Stouder
Reviews.Content: I like this better than my daughters Ipad that is provided by our local high school.  Much more useful for adult projects instead of kiddie games.  I will admit and I don't care for Apple products so take my review with a grain of salt.
Reviews.Title: Nic Product

Reviews.Author: hector vasquez
Reviews.Content: It took 4 times for it to get to me, but it was worth it. The first one was defective,  I sent that one back they sent me 3 more. first 2 I did not receive It was not amazons fault. It was the fault of the shipping company. Finally after the third attempt I receive my note 10.1 2013 edition. and I could not be happier It is a great  product it's super fast and the screen is the best looking screen I have ever seen on a tablet. Samsung has stepped up their game.
Reviews.Title: It took 4 times for it to get to me.

Reviews.Author: MommaD
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for our daughter-in-law's birthday in January.  She LOVED it!  Six months later, she still LOVES her Galaxy Note and has me wanting one too!  I recommend this to anyone looking for a Galaxy Note.
Reviews.Title: GREAT GIFT!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Finally, I gave in and decided to buy a tablet after resisting the idea all these many years of our abletized history. I have two Alienwares, an all-in-one Gateway touchscreen desktop, a Kindle (Paperwhite edition), and a Galaxy Note 3 smartphone. On top of these, I have a powerful desktop which I built myself with top-of-the-line pieces of hardware. Why should I buy a tablet? That's the question I asked myself over and over before I bought the new Galaxy Note 10.1 (2014 edition) with LTE.I told myself that after buying the tablet, it would be my chief e-reader and I'd have to give away my Kindle. I thought it would make for a great browsing device while lying down in bed. Well, I was wrong. My new tablet CANNOT replace my Kindle. The reading experience with my Kindle is much more better. The Kindle Paperwhite is superb; it feels much like a book and offers more than any physical book can. Holding the Kindle is more comfortable compared to by new tablet. There is no way the table can replace my Kindle.As far as browsing the internet goes, I really do not know where this tablet fits. It's neither as small and easy to hold as my smartphone, nor is it as sophisticated as mt M11x laptop. It cannot render web pages as good as my laptop can; it does not run smoothly as my laptop either. Plus, you really would need a kickstand of some sort if you are going to be viewing an hour-long movie on it; not so with my laptop. For those, who thing this tablet, or any tablet for that matter, for that matter will be great for note-taking in classrooms and board meetings, I'd say good luck to you. You can draw with this tablet, scribble short notes, create scrapbooks, and do some other little things like that. But as far as serious note-taking is concerned, no note-taking on a tablet can compare to writing with a pen on an actual piece of paper. Period!To be fair, the tablet is gorgeous as far as tablet goes and has some impressive specs, but I still do not know what task to assign to this device. What sort of task will be best done on a tablet? That's the answer I am yet to find.Some people have complained of occasional lag and stutter with this tablet. I have noticed it too. It makes my wonder what good the 3GB of RAM does. Why would Samsung tot optimize it's Touchwiz to prevent this sort of thing?With all that said, and this is why I rated the tablet with 4 stars, this appears to be the best Android tablet in the market today. I say this with respect to it's design, hardware specs, and level of performance (bearing in mind what tablets can actually do).
Reviews.Title: I still do not know what task to assign to my tablet

Reviews.Author: Javier
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet used in Amazon warehouse deals for less than 300 dollars, No lags so far and everything works like new.
Reviews.Title: Perfect for me!

Reviews.Author: Matthew Meredith
Reviews.Content: I use this tablet on the daily. I put Sooo much research into getting my first tablet back in late 2013 and feel still to this day I made the right choice and wouldn't trade it for any other. Has lots of helpful features but also the power to back them up.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet

Reviews.Author: Michael C. Galloway
Reviews.Content: Does everything I want a Google tablet to do and more.Syncs perfectly with my Samsung Galaxy phone.Battery life is great could be a little better though.
Reviews.Title: Amazing Table.

Reviews.Author: David D. "David"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my iPad 4. I've grown tired of the limitations of the Apple ecosystem and have been looking for a replacement. I tried the Asus T100,  but it had bad connectivity issues with keyboard and it was constantly losing Bluetooth connections.  I love Windows 8, but I didn't want to restrict myself to RT, so that eliminated most other Windows tablets under $1K. So I decided to give Android a try and so far I love it.
Reviews.Title: First rate tablet

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for the features it has - 32GB storage plus an external SD card slot.  I came across this factory refurb at a lower cost so I pulled the trigger.  Even so it is an expensive toy.  The idea was to have a highly portable device with a bigger screen than my phone that I could also use at the office in meetings in place pen & paper - view edocs, take notes, etc.  I have loaded a couple videos on it and they look pretty great when played.  I will save a few more to while away boring travel time on some upcoming trips.  The battery life seems quite good.  It lasts a full day under my normal use - your mileage may vary.  I have run it down in a day when using it heavily especially in a bright area which causes the screen to brighten up.  All in all I am very happy with the tablet.  It has performed well for what I purchased it to do.  It is hard to justify the price for my usage, but it is cool and fun to use.
Reviews.Title: Wonderful tablet but pricey

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I have a smaller Samsung Tablet but wanted something a little bigger for movies, games, etc... This one is perfect! Love the leather back, it's light, thin and I can attach a keyboard! Picture is amazing. One thing I do not like is all the apps that come on it, I did not need all that crazy, but I just made a folder for the Crap Apps and BAM out of my way :). This is by far the best tablet I've ever bought.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet

Reviews.Author: Retired Geek "consumer"
Reviews.Content: Wow,  I have used an ASUS transformer prime for about two years now.  My wife has the older version of the Note 10.1.  I have used her's and was impressed, but the speed was not all that much better than the prime.  When this model came out, I was hopefully that with the new processor and the 3 GByte ram that would be changed.  Wow!  Much faster than the older Note.  As soon as I turned it on, it started downloading the newest version of Android (4.4.2).  I was on the fence between this and the Surface.  Considering the new surface announcement about the surface models, I chose the Note.  VERY GOOD decision!!!You will love it too  -  -  if you are a fan of Android OS.
Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014

Reviews.Author: Tarannum Syed
Reviews.Content: One of the best tablet I ever had.Very nice display and easy to use.Although little expensive but it worth it.
Reviews.Title: Love this product

Reviews.Author: Sosegado
Reviews.Content: This really is a great tablet.  Crystal clear and fast.  What more do you want?  Worth the extra money I thought.
Reviews.Title: Badass

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: They need to offer more customization with the settings and s-pen controls. Need to make pen use even more intuitive and expand on the great ideas they experimented with but didn't fully develop such as the scrap booker, s-note, s-pen button versatility, etc. still way awesome though.
Reviews.Title: Awesome potential but not fully unleashed.

Reviews.Author: Raul Pinheiro
Reviews.Content: This Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 edition is a great device. Really good display resolution, lots of softwares available from Google Play, and the capability of using a precise stylus makes it a multi purpose gadget. I use it to read, to draw, play games, see videos online any other media. A little weighty, but you get used to it. Really nice choice.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet

Reviews.Author: Jeanine R.
Reviews.Content: I love my tablet. It great. I only wish they left the speakers on top as in previous versions. The tablet is easy to use, very user friendly and fast
Reviews.Title: Quality of Product

Reviews.Author: 2yorkiemama
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this device. I am not an Apple fan.  I don't like the iPad,  etc.  I cannot say enough good things about it. I debated on this or the regular tablet. I liked the specs better on this so I decided to go with it. I'm loving the S pen. It's fun and really quite accurate.  This has met and even exceeded my expectations.  It's light and slim. I travel every week, and this is an excellent portable companion. I would highly recommend this to anyone.
Reviews.Title: Perfect for me!

Reviews.Author: Alexandra
Reviews.Content: It was a gift for my brother and he is loving so much. I'm probably buying one for me soon
Reviews.Title: Excellent buy

Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: I have owned a logo xoom and a tf201. I ended up very disappointed with both of them because they couldn't do it. This is finally what I wanted in a tablet. I'm into a tech which is also going with the pens. I love my blogs which this loads very fast, some tablets before this couldn't even load a Web page. I love the back pleather. It's great. Thank you Samsung looking for forward to the S5
Reviews.Title: What I have been waiting for

Reviews.Author: Craig D. Stewart
Reviews.Content: So responsive to the touch and viewing video, and pictures is so clear. Still learning how to do stuff with it. Can't keep my hands off of it!
Reviews.Title: It's just great!!!

Reviews.Author: Antoine Jordan
Reviews.Content: Item was delivered promptly and the packaging was flawless. Really love this tablet, spent the first night exploring and barely got any sleep because I couldn't bring myself to put it down.
Reviews.Title: Love the tablet!

Reviews.Author: AK
Reviews.Content: Everything is OK. After some time of research into all tablets - that what I choose, and it meet my expectations.
Reviews.Title: Very Good!

Reviews.Author: gabriel
Reviews.Content: Good Morning, this product exceed my expectations, is so useful to take my life to another level, increase my productivity this tablet is Excellent..!!
Reviews.Title: Excellent.

Reviews.Author: GT ACE "Say something about yourself!"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have had about eight iPads and currently own two. Needless to say we are Apple fans! Recently the newer Samsung Galaxy Note 8 and the Galaxy Note 10.1 caught our eye! We actually traded/returned a new iPad Air for the Galaxy Note 8.I really like my new Galaxy 10.1 but it does take a little time to get familiar with Android systems just as it does if you switch back and forth between a Mac and a Windows PC.The Galaxy Note 10.1 feels well made, on about the same par as the iPads but I like the leather stiched back of the Galaxy as it feels nicer in my hands.The screen size is almost as big as the larger iPads and screen quality is fabulous. I will keep my two iPads close but I will probably spend a lot of time on the Galaxy now. I have not had the Galaxy long enough to know how it's battery will stack up against the IPad but the iPad is going to be very hard to match or exceed!
Reviews.Title: My first Samsung tablet!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This device has only one shortcoming in my perspective, less than average battery life.  It excels at the everything else.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet.

Reviews.Author: Delta
Reviews.Content: I had checked out several tablets before deciding on this one. I knew it was good but as I'm using the S pen more, I'm discovering ways to stop using paper more and more.
Reviews.Title: What a surprise!

Reviews.Author: CJR
Reviews.Content: Looked great, fantastic graphics, runs fast. Easy to use. Too bad I could not find an Otterbox cover that fit.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet

Reviews.Author: cmoorefun1
Reviews.Content: Works great !Easy to use and transfer your contacts, pictures and music!I have only had a few days and am still learning the functions and abilities.It sinks up with my Samsung Note II Phone and works well togetherCons: No standard SD Card slot
Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet !!

Reviews.Author: Matthew Trout
Reviews.Content: It works great. Handles tasks fast and the user interface is very nice. Everything is easy to find and if you just find and watch a 5 minute tutorial on it on YouTube the shortcuts are amazing.  I also recommend buying the 16 GB as 64 GB Class 10 SD cards are cheaper then the upgrade price for 32 GB. SD card --> http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B009QZH6JS/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_5
Reviews.Title: Great performace.

Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my note. I had been debating making the jump from pen and paper to electronic note taking and I have to say that the note makes it so simple. There are so many apps you can use to read and annotate PDF's and take notes/record lectures. I can copy and paste from my book PDF directly into my notes! My notes have never been better. The integrated s-pen and wacom technology in the tablet provide such a smooth and natural writing experience. I opted to buy a larger pen (Wacom Bamboo feel) since I do a lot of note taking.  The price is a little steep but I don't regret purchasing this tablet.
Reviews.Title: Great for students

Reviews.Author: Bruce Keeton
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my wife.  The tablet is great but the battery life seems to be lacking and doesn't seem to last as long as my iPad does with similar use.Also, my wife has noticed some "glitches" in the software and it appears to hang on occasion.Overall for what she uses it for (web, email, games) it is a good product.
Reviews.Title: It is okay for what we use it for

Reviews.Author: Rob Bushong
Reviews.Content: My son absolutely loves the Samsung!!! It was just what he wanted, with all the features you can ask for!
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!!

Reviews.Author: Denise Hannigan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my husband as a gift for Christmas since I am the one who usually ends up with a new tablet every couple of years.  He absolutely loves the quality and the screen resolution, he loves everything he can do on it.
Reviews.Title: Absolutely In Love

Reviews.Author: Awesome
Reviews.Content: Its a great tablet it has a gorgeos 10.1 amoled screen that blow the colors away, is super fast and smooth, it feels great in hands. On the prductivity side is the best you can find for anything! Reviews.Title: disappointed
